Overview and visualization of spatial-level transforms from albumentations package

Image augmentation is a machine learning technique that “boomed” in recent years along with the large deep learning systems. In this article, we present a visualization of spatial-level augmentation techniques available in the albumentations.

The provided descriptions mostly come the official project documentation available at https://albumentations.ai/

Some of the transformations can only be applied to images, others also to bboxes and keypoints, the below table (from https://github.com/albumentations-team/albumentations#spatial-level-transforms) describes it in detail

Transform Image Masks BBoxes Keypoints
CenterCrop ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
CoarseDropout ✓ ✓
Crop ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
CropNonEmptyMaskIfExists ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
ElasticTransform ✓ ✓
Flip ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
GridDistortion ✓ ✓
GridDropout ✓ ✓
HorizontalFlip ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAAAffine ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAACropAndPad ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAAFliplr ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAAFlipud ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAAPerspective ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
IAAPiecewiseAffine ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
Lambda ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
LongestMaxSize ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
MaskDropout ✓ ✓
NoOp ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
OpticalDistortion ✓ ✓
PadIfNeeded ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomCrop ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomCropNearBBox ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomGridShuffle ✓ ✓
RandomResizedCrop ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomRotate90 ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomScale ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomSizedBBoxSafeCrop ✓ ✓ ✓
RandomSizedCrop ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

Transpose ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
VerticalFlip ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

Image that will be transformed

from os.path import join
from PIL import Image
import numpy as np
path = join("lime_image", "husky_train", "47.jpg")

img = Image.open(path)
img = img.resize((384, 384))
img

image = np.asarray(img)

CenterCrop

Crop the central part of the input.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import CenterCrop

height, width = 200, 200

transform = CenterCrop(height, width, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

CoarseDropout

CoarseDropout of the rectangular regions in the image.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import CoarseDropout


max_holes=10
max_height=50
max_width=8
min_holes=1
min_height=None
min_width=None
fill_value=255
mask_fill_value=None

transform =CoarseDropout(max_holes, max_height, max_width, min_holes, min_height, min_width,
                         fill_value, mask_fill_value, 
                         p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

Crop

Crop region from image.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Crop


x_min=0
y_min=0
x_max=384
y_max=200


transform =Crop(x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

ElasticTransform

Elastic deformation of images as described in [Simard2003]_ (with modifications). Based on https://gist.github.com/erniejunior/601cdf56d2b424757de5

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import ElasticTransform


alpha=10
sigma=150
alpha_affine=50
interpolation=1
border_mode=4
value=17
mask_value=105


transform = ElasticTransform (alpha, sigma, alpha_affine, interpolation, border_mode, value, mask_value, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

Flip

Flip the input either horizontally, vertically or both horizontally and vertically.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Flip

transform = Flip(p=1.0)
d=-1

augmented_image = transform(image=image, d=d)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

GridDistortion

Add distorition to the image, not really well documanted, hyperparameters are not clear for me

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import GridDistortion

num_steps=50
distort_limit=0.5
interpolation=1
border_mode=4
value=None
mask_value=None

transform = GridDistortion(num_steps, distort_limit, interpolation, border_mode, value, mask_value, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

GridDropout

GridDropout, drops out rectangular regions of an image and the corresponding mask in a grid fashion.

Inspired by Chen et al. paper from 2020, avalible here: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2001.04086.pdf

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import GridDropout

ratio=0.4
unit_size_min=2
unit_size_max=19
holes_number_x= 10
holes_number_y= 10
shift_x=100 
shift_y=0
random_offset=False

transform = GridDropout(ratio, unit_size_min, unit_size_max, holes_number_x,
                        holes_number_y, shift_x, shift_y, random_offset, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

HorizontalFlip

Flip the input horizontally around the y-axis.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import HorizontalFlip

transform = HorizontalFlip(p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAAAffine

Place a regular grid of points on the input and randomly move the neighbourhood of these point around via affine transformations.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAAAffine

scale=0.1
translate_percent=10
translate_px=None
rotate=0.5
shear=0.5
order=1
cval=0
mode='reflect'

transform = IAAAffine(scale, translate_percent, translate_px, rotate, shear, order, cval, mode, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAAAdditiveGaussianNoise

Add gaussian noise to the input image.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAAAdditiveGaussianNoise

loc=50
scale=(5, 12.75)
per_channel=True

transform = IAAAdditiveGaussianNoise(loc, scale, per_channel, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAAEmboss

Emboss the input image and overlays the result with the original image.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAAEmboss

alpha=(0.2, 0.5)
strength=(0.2, 0.7)

transform = IAAEmboss(alpha, strength, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAAPerspective

Perform a random four point perspective transform of the input.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Flip

transform = Flip(p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAAPiecewiseAffine

Perform a random four point perspective transform of the input.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAAPerspective 

scale=(0.3, 0.1)
keep_size=True

transform = IAAPerspective(scale, keep_size, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAASharpen

Sharpen the input image and overlays the result with the original image.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAAPerspective 

alpha=(0.1, 0.3)
lightness=(0.1, 1.0)

transform = IAAPerspective(alpha, lightness, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

IAASuperpixels

Completely or partially transform the input image to its superpixel representation. Uses skimage’s version of the SLIC algorithm. May be slow.

from albumentations.imgaug.transforms import IAASuperpixels 

p_replace=0.5
n_segments=10

transform = IAASuperpixels(p_replace, n_segments, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

LongestMaxSize

Rescale an image so that maximum side is equal to max_size, keeping the aspect ratio of the initial image.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import LongestMaxSize

transform = LongestMaxSize(max_size=512, interpolation=1, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

OpticalDistortion

No description, hyperparameters not clear

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import OpticalDistortion

distort_limit=2.5
shift_limit=0.9
interpolation=1
border_mode=4
value=None
mask_value=None

transform = OpticalDistortion(distort_limit, shift_limit, interpolation, border_mode, value, mask_value, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomCrop

Crop a random part of the input.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomCrop

height, width = 300, 200

transform = RandomCrop(height, width, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomGridShuffle

Random shuffle grid’s cells on image.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomGridShuffle

transform = RandomGridShuffle(grid=(4, 3), p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomResizedCrop

Torchvision’s variant of crop a random part of the input and rescale it to some size.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomResizedCrop

height, width = 384, 384
scale=(0.08, 1.0)
ratio=(0.75, 1.3333333333333333)
interpolation=1

transform = RandomResizedCrop(height, width, scale, ratio, interpolation, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomRotate90

Randomly rotate the input by 90 degrees zero or more times.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomRotate90

transform = RandomRotate90(p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomScale

Randomly resize the input. Output image size is different from the input image size.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomScale

scale_limit=0.5
interpolation=1

transform = RandomScale(scale_limit, interpolation, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

RandomSizedCrop

Crop a random part of the input and rescale it to some size.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import RandomSizedCrop

min_max_height = (150, 250)
height = 384
width = 384
w2h_ratio = 0.5
interpolation=1

transform = RandomSizedCrop(min_max_height, height, width, w2h_ratio, interpolation, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

Resize

Resize the input to the given height and width.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Resize

height, width = 200, 200

transform = Resize(height, width, interpolation=1, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

Rotate

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Rotate

limit=90
interpolation=1
border_mode=4
value=None
mask_value=None

transform = Rotate(limit, interpolation, border_mode, value, mask_value, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

ShiftScaleRotate

Rescale an image so that minimum side is equal to max_size, keeping the aspect ratio of the initial image.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import ShiftScaleRotate

shift_limit=0.0625
scale_limit=0.5
rotate_limit=90
interpolation=1

transform = ShiftScaleRotate(shift_limit, scale_limit, rotate_limit, interpolation, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

SmallestMaxSize

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import SmallestMaxSize

max_size=500
interpolation=1

transform = SmallestMaxSize (max_size, interpolation, p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

Transpose

Transpose the input by swapping rows and columns.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import Transpose

transform = Transpose(p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)

VerticalFlip

Flip the input vertically around the x-axis.

from albumentations.augmentations.transforms import VerticalFlip

transform = VerticalFlip(p=1.0)

augmented_image = transform(image=image)['image']
Image.fromarray(augmented_image)
